sentence.Network_en: He volleyed the ball spectacularly into the far corner of the net.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一脚漂亮的凌空抽射，把球踢进了球门的远角。

sentence.Network_en: Many of her movies had been spectacularly successful.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的很多电影都获得了巨大的成功。

entry.tran: 引人注目的;惊人的;壮观的
entry.def: Something that is spectacular is very impressive or dramatic.

example.ex: ...spectacular views of the Sugar Loaf Mountain...
They have revamped the business with spectacular success...
example.tran: 他们成功地调整了业务，成绩斐然。

entry.tran: 壮观的表演;盛大的演出
entry.def: A spectacular is a show or performance which is very grand and impressive.

example.ex: ...one of the world's great sporting spectaculars.
example.tran: 世界上最壮观的体育盛事之一

auth_sentence.content: True, it's unlikely to be spectacularly staged.

auth_sentence.content: Yesterday, spectacularly, the wheels came off.
